name: Splinter Sit-ups
how_to_perform:
1. Start by lying on your back on the ground, with your arms extended overhead and your legs straight.

2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your lower back does not arch or your hips do not sag upwards throughout the movement.

3. Slowly lift your shoulders off the ground without lifting your feet, keeping your lower back pressed into the ground.

4. As you reach the top of the movement, focus on contracting your abdominal muscles to help stabilize your body and provide additional support for your spine.

5. Hold this position briefly at the contracted state.

6. Slowly return to the starting position, with control, and avoid using momentum or jerking movements throughout the repetition.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on maintaining a slow and controlled tempo.
short_summary: Splinter sit-ups are an upper body exercise that primarily works the rectus abdominis muscles, helping to improve core strength and stability.
